trigger_event: While fixing a critical malfunction, Lenart discovers the system is about to revive all historical BCI data for every citizen, exposing decades-old secrets and infractions to the present.
dilemma: Lenart must decide whether to allow the system to reveal all historical BCI data, forcing the city to confront its hidden past, or reroute the crisis through the Halden Echoes oracle so citizens receive personal alternate history stories instead.
reason: Lenart knows whichever choice he makes will define how the city reckons with its past—either through harsh truth or imaginative possibility. The weight of responsibility is heavy; a wrong move could spark outrage or weaken the city’s trust in the system. His recent late-night conversations with Alex, the bartender, have left him torn between the need for order and the hope of forgiveness.
choice_a: Let the system upload and reveal all historical BCI data to citizens’ current records, causing old secrets to come to light.
belief_a: Order comes from facing uncomfortable truths head-on.
Systems must remain transparent and accountable, no matter the fallout.
Only by reckoning with collective memory can people move forward.
choice_b: Override the process and redirect the crisis to the Halden Echoes oracle, letting people see visions of what their lives could have been instead.
belief_b: Healing comes from understanding and forgiveness.
People deserve the hope of second chances, not endless punishment.
Imagination and empathy can build a future stronger than fear.
